titleStmt.title:
Letter, J. L. Donaldson
in Nashville, Tenn., to Thomas Swords in Cincinnati, Ohio,
1864 February 9

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, J. L. Donaldson in Nashville, Tenn. to Thomas Swords in Cincinnati, Ohio, 1864 February 9
bibl.extent: 2 digital images; 0.3 linear feet; 1 envelope, 1 p.
bibl.note: In this letter, dated February 9, 1864, from Lieutenant Colonel J. L. Donaldson in Nashville Tennessee, he asks Colonel Thomas Swords in Cincinatti, Ohio, to provide transportation for W. H. Bristol according to the terms agreed with Colonel D. C. McCallum in Nashville, Tenn. The contract was for the reconstruction of the Tennessee River Bridge at Loudon, Tenn.

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

keywords.term: Railroad bridges -- Tennessee -- Loudon County -- Design and construction.

revisionDesc.change: Migrating from XML to validated TEI P5.

div.p: I enclose certified copy of letter this day received from Col. D.C. McCallum, Genl. Mangr. Milt. R.R. Div. Miss.

You will notice by the terms of Col. McCallum's contract with Mr Bristol, that it is agreed that Mr Bristol shall have transportation for men material & supplies from Cincinnati & Louisville by Boat or R.R. at the rates paid by the U.S. and transportation back at the same rates.
I will thank you to make such arrangements for Mr Bristol on his applica. to you.
